result.execSummary:
The defendant Synthera P Caston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/15/2015; alternate 6 days jail. (payment plan of $15.00 to be added)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Synthera P Caston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Synthera P Caston in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Fine totaling $267.50 to be paid  at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/15/2015; alternate 6 days jail
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 9/25/15.
Hearing at 09-25-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Synthera P Caston in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests another date in 30 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 8/24/15.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Attorney appears by authorization

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Synthera P Caston did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney appears by authorization.  State has offer to amend charge. Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing date in August to resolve this matter. Court will give another date at the end of August for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 5/6/15.
Hearing on May 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
No contact with Donavin H. or his residence.

Defendant Synthera P Caston in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. Court grants the Motion and modified the bond.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Martinez
Request denied by Judge Aprahamian - only 2 of 3 co-defendant's subbed.
Defendant Synthera P Caston in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Arraignment on March 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with co-actor or his residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Synthera P Caston in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Arraignment scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:00 am.
